data.title: List of awards and nominations received by Quentin Tarantino

data.text:
This article needs additional citations for verification. Please help improve this article by adding citations to reliable sources. Unsourced material may be challenged and removed.

Script error: No such module "Find sources". (January 2021)

Awards and nominations received by director Quentin TarantinoTemplate:SHORTDESC:Awards and nominations received by director Quentin Tarantino

Template:Infobox awards list

The following is a list of awards and nominations received by American director, producer, and screenwriter Quentin Tarantino. In 1994, for his work on Pulp Fiction, he was nominated for the Academy Award for Best Director and for Best Original Screenplay, winning the latter. While Pulp Fiction was nominated for Best Picture, Tarantino wasn't a listed producer. He was nominated for the same categories in 2009 for Inglourious Basterds, and in 2012 he again won Best Original Screenplay for Django Unchained. He received his first Best Picture nomination for Once Upon a Time in Hollywood due to his producer’s credit.

Awards and nominations[]

Year Nominated work Result 2020 Once Upon a Time in Hollywood Nominated

Year Nominated work Result 1995 Pulp Fiction Nominated 2010 Inglourious Basterds Nominated 2020 Once Upon a Time in Hollywood Nominated

Year Nominated work Result 1995 Pulp Fiction Won 2010 Inglourious Basterds Nominated 2013 Django Unchained Won 2020 Once Upon a Time in Hollywood Nominated

Stinkers Bad Movie Awards[]

Year Nominated work Category Result 1996 From Dusk till Dawn Worst Supporting Actor Nominated

Other lifetime honors[]

2005 Icon of the Decade Award at the 10th Empire Awards.

2007 Lifetime achievement award at the Malacañan Palace in Manila.[1]

2008 Filmmaker on the Edge Award at the Provincetown International Film Festival.

2010 Order of Merit of the Hungarian Republic along with Lucy Liu and Andy Vajna for producing the 2006 film Freedom's Fury.[2]

2011 honorary César from the Académie des Arts et Techniques du Cinéma.[3]

2013 Lifetime Achievement Award by the Rome Film Festival.[4]

2013 Prix Lumière, at the fifth Festival Lumière, in Lyon, France.
